register.name: CON
register.description: CPUx Temporal Protection System Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: TEXP0
field.description: Timer0 Expired Flag TEXP0. Set when the corresponding timer expires. Cleared on any write to the TIMER0 register.

field.name: TEXP1
field.description: Timer1 Expired Flag TEXP1. Set when the corresponding timer expires. Cleared on any write to the TIMER1 register.

field.name: TEXP2
field.description: Timer1 Expired Flag TEXP2. Set when the corresponding timer expires. Cleared on any write to the TIMER1 register.

field.name: TTRAP
field.description: Temporal Protection Trap TTRAP. If set indicates that a TAE trap has been requested. Any subsequent TAE traps are disabled. A write clears the flag and re enables TAE traps.

register.name: TIMER[%s]
register.description: CPUx Temporal Protection System Timer Register 0 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: Timer
field.description: Temporal Protection Timer Timer. Writing zero de activates the Timer. Writing a non zero value starts the Timer. Any write clears the corresponding TPS CON.TEXP flag. Read returns the current Timer value.

register.name: ENTRY_LVAL
register.description: CPUx Exception Entry Timer Load Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ENTRY_LVAL
field.description: Exception Entry Timer Load value ENTRY LVAL. Value loaded into the exception entry timer on detection of an enabled exception. Bits 3 0 are constrained to be 0

register.name: ENTRY_CVAL
register.description: CPUx Exception Entry Timer Current Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ENTRY_CVAL
field.description: Exception Entry Timer Current Value ENTRY CVAL. Current value of the exception entry timer.

register.name: EXIT_LVAL
register.description: CPUx Exception Exit Timer Load Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: EXIT_LVAL
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Load value EXIT LVAL. Value loaded into the exception exit timer on detection of an enabled exception. Bits 3 0 are constrained to be 0

register.name: EXIT_CVAL
register.description: CPUx Exception Exit Timer Current Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: EXIT_CVAL
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Current Value EXIT CVAL. Current value of the exception exit timer.

register.name: CLASS_EN
register.description: CPUx Exception Timer Class Enable Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: EXTIM_CLASS_EN
field.description: Exception Timer Class Enables EXTIM CLASS EN. Trap Class enables for exception timer.

register.name: STAT
register.description: CPUx Exception Timer Status Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: EXIT_TIN
field.description: Exception Exit Timer TIN EXIT TIN. Exception Exit Timer TIN of triggering trap.

field.name: EXIT_CLASS
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Class EXIT CLASS. Exception exit Timer Class of triggering trap.

field.name: EXIT_AT
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Alarm Triggered EXIT AT. Exception Exit Timer Alarm triggered sticky bit. Alarm triggered since last cleared.

field.name: ENTRY_TIN
field.description: Exception Entry Timer TIN ENTRY TIN. Exception Entry Timer TIN of triggering trap.

field.name: ENTRY_CLASS
field.description: Exception Entry Timer Class ENTRY CLASS. Exception Entry Timer Class of triggering trap.

field.name: ENTRY_AT
field.description: Exception Entry Timer Alarm Triggered ENTRY AT. Exception Entry Timer Alarm triggered sticky bit. Alarm triggered since last cleared.

register.name: FCX

field.name: EXIT_FCX
field.description: Exception Exit Timer FCX EXIT FCX. Exception Exit Timer FCX of triggering trap.

register.name: CON
register.description: CPUx Trap Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: TST
field.description: Trap Status TST

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No instruction captured. The next enabled exception will cause the exceptional instruction to be captured.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Instruction captured. No further enabled exceptions will be captured until TST is cleared.

field.name: TCL
field.description: Trap Clear TCL. Read always reads as 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Clears the trapped instruction TST will be negated .

field.name: RM
field.description: Captured Rounding Mode RM. The rounding mode of the captured instruction. Only valid when TST is asserted. Note that this is the rounding mode supplied to the FPU for the exceptional instruction. UPDFL instructions may cause a trap and change the rounding mode. In this case the RM bits capture the input rounding mode

field.name: FXE
field.description: FX Trap Enable FXE. When set an instruction generating an FX exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FUE
field.description: FU Trap Enable FUE. When set an instruction generating an FU exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FZE
field.description: FZ Trap Enable FZE. When set an instruction generating an FZ exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FVE
field.description: FV Trap Enable FVE. When set an instruction generating an FV exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FIE
field.description: FI Trap Enable FIE. When set an instruction generating an FI exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FX
field.description: Captured FX FX. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FX. Only valid when TST is asserted.

field.name: FU
field.description: Captured FU FU. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FU. Only valid when TST is asserted.

field.name: FZ
field.description: Captured FZ FZ. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FZ. Only valid when TST is asserted

field.name: FV
field.description: Captured FV FV. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FV. Only valid when TST is asserted

field.name: FI
field.description: Captured FI FI. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FI. Only valid when TST is asserted

register.name: PC
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Program Counter Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: PC
field.description: Captured Program Counter PC. The program counter virtual address of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: OPC
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Opcode Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: OPC
field.description: Captured Opcode OPC. The secondary opcode of the captured instruction. When FPU TRAP OPC.FMT 0 only bits 3 0 are defined. OPC is valid only when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

field.name: FMT
field.description: Captured Instruction Format FMT. The format of the captured instruction s opcode. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 RRR

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 RR

field.name: DREG
field.description: Captured Destination Register DREG. The destination register of the captured instruction. ... Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Data general purpose register 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_1515
enumeratedValue.description: F Data general purpose register 15.

register.name: SRC1
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC1
field.description: Captured SRC1 Operand SRC1. The SRC1 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: SRC2
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC2
field.description: Captured SRC2 Operand SRC2. The SRC2 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: SRC3
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC3
field.description: Captured SRC3 Operand SRC3. The SRC3 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: TRiEVT
register.description: CPUx Trigger Event 0 resetvalue={Debug Reset:0x0}

field.name: EVTA
field.description: Event Associated EVTA. Specifies the Debug Action associated with the Debug Event

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 000 BOD 0 Disabled. BOD 1 Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 001 BOD 0 Pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 010 BOD 0 Halt and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Halt.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 011 BOD 0 Breakpoint trap and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Breakpoint trap.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_44
enumeratedValue.description: 100 BOD 0 Breakpoint interrupt 0 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Breakpoint interrupt 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_55
enumeratedValue.description: 101 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 1 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 1. If not implemented None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_66
enumeratedValue.description: 110 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 2 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 2. If not implemented None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_77
enumeratedValue.description: 111 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3. If not implemented None.

field.name: BBM
field.description: Break Before Make BBM or Break After Make BAM Selection BBM. Code triggers BBM or BAM selection. Data access and data code combination access triggers can only create BAM Debug Events. When these triggers occur TRnEVT.BBM is ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Code only triggers Break After Make BAM .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Code only triggers Break Before Make BBM .

field.name: BOD
field.description: Breakout Disable BOD

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 BRKOUT signal asserted according to the action specified in the EVTA field.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 BRKOUT signal not asserted. This takes priority over any assertion generated by the EVTA field.

field.name: SUSP
field.description: CDC Suspend Out Signal State SUSP. Value to be assigned to the CDC suspend out signal when the Debug Event is raised.

field.name: CNT
field.description: Counter CNT. When this event occurs adjust the control of the performance counters in task mode as follows

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 No change.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Start the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Stop the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 Toggle the performance counter control i.e. start it if it is currently stopped stop it if it is currently running .

field.name: TYP
field.description: Input Selection TYP

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Address

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 PC

field.name: RNG
field.description: Compare Type RNG. Once an even numbered comparator has been set to range the EVTR settings of its associated upper neighbour will be ignored.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Range

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Equality

field.name: ASI_EN
field.description: Enable ASI Comparison ASI EN

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No ASI comparison performed. Debug Trigger is valid for all processes.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Enable ASI comparison. Debug Events are only triggered when the current process ASI matches TRnEVT.ASI.

field.name: ASI
field.description: Address Space Identifier ASI. The ASI of the Debug Trigger process.

field.description: Address Store AST. Used in conjunction with TYP 0

field.name: ALD

field.description: Address Space Identifier ASI. The ASI register contains the Address Space Identifier of the current process.

register.name: PMA0
register.description: CPUx Data Access CacheabilityRegister resetvalue={Application Reset:0x300}

field.name: DAC
field.description: Data Access Cacheability Segments FHto 0H DAC. Note segments F H E H D H and A H are constrained to be non cacheable

register.name: PMA1
register.description: CPUx Code Access CacheabilityRegister resetvalue={Application Reset:0x300}

field.description: Code Access Cacheability Segments FH 0H CAC. Note Segments F H E H C H A H are constrained to be non cacheable

register.name: COMPAT
register.description: CPUx Compatibility Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0FFFFFFFF}

field.name: RM
field.description: Rounding Mode Compatibility RM

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 PSW.RM not restored by RET.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 PSW.RM restored by RET TC1.3 behavior .

field.name: SP

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00

register.name: PCXI
register.description: CPUx Previous Context Information Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: PCXO
field.description: Previous Context Pointer Offset Field PCXO. The PCXO and PCXS fields form the pointer PCX which points to the CSA of the previous context.

field.name: PCXS
field.description: Previous Context Pointer Segment Address PCXS. Contains the segment address portion of the PCX. This field is used in conjunction with the PCXO field.

field.name: UL
field.description: Upper or Lower Context Tag UL. Identifies the type of context saved. If the type does not match the type expected when a context restore operation is performed a trap is generated.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Lower Context

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Upper Context

field.name: PIE
field.description: Previous Interrupt Enable PIE. Indicates the state of the interrupt enable bit ICR.IE for the interrupted task.

field.name: PCPN
field.description: Previous CPU Priority Number PCPN. Contains the priority level number of the interrupted task.

register.name: PSW
register.description: CPUx Program Status Word resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0B80}

field.name: CDC
field.description: Call Depth Counter CDC. Consists of two variable width subfields. The first subfield consists of a string of zero or more initial 1 bits terminated by the first 0 bit. The remaining bits form the second subfield CDC.COUNT which constitutes the Call Depth Count value. The count value is incremented on each Call and is decremented on a Return. 0cccccc B 6 bit counter trap on overflow. 10ccccc B 5 bit counter trap on overflow. 110cccc B 4 bit counter trap on overflow. 1110ccc B 3 bit counter trap on overflow. 11110cc B 2 bit counter trap on overflow. 111110c B 1 bit counter trap on overflow. 1111110 B Trap every call Call Trace mode . 1111111 B Disable Call Depth Counting. When the call depth count CDC.COUNT overflows a trap CDO is generated. Setting the CDC to 1111110 B allows no bits for the counter and causes every call to be trapped. This is used for Call Depth Tracing. Setting the CDC to 1111111 B disables Call Depth Counting.

field.name: CDE
field.description: Call Depth Count Enable CDE. Enables call depth counting provided that the PSW.CDC mask field is not all set to 1. If PSW.CDC 1111111 B call depth counting is disabled regardless of the setting on the PSW.CDE bit.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Call depth counting is temporarily disabled. It is automatically re enabled after execution of the next Call instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Call depth counting is enabled.

field.name: IS
field.description: Interrupt Stack Control IS. Determines if the current execution thread is using the shared global interrupt stack or a user stack.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 User Stack. If an interrupt is taken when the IS bit is 0 then the stack pointer register is loaded from the ISP register before execution starts at the first instruction of the Interrupt Service Routine ISR .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Shared Global Stack. If an interrupt is taken when the PSW.IS bit is 1 then the current value of the stack pointer is used by the Interrupt Service Routine ISR .

field.name: IO
field.description: Access Privilege Level Control I O Privilege IO. Determines the access level to special function registers and peripheral devices.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 User 0 Mode No peripheral access. Access to memory regions with the peripheral space attribute are prohibited and results in a PSE or MPP trap. This access level is given to tasks that need not directly access peripheral devices. Tasks at this level do not have permission to enable or disable interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 User 1 Mode Regular peripheral access. Enables access to common peripheral devices that are not specially protected including read write access to serial I O ports read access to timers and access to most I O status registers. Tasks at this level may disable interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Supervisor Mode Enables access to all peripheral devices. It enables read write access to core registers and protected peripheral devices. Tasks at this level may disable interrupts.

field.name: S
field.description: Safe Task Identifier S

field.name: USB
field.description: User Status Bits USB. The eight most significant bits of the PSW are designated as User Status Bits. These bits may be set or cleared as side effects of instruction execution. Refer to the TriCore Architecture manual for details.

register.name: BIV
register.description: CPUx Base Interrupt Vector Table Pointer resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: VSS
field.description: Vector Spacing Select VSS. 0 32 byte vector spacing. 1 8 Byte vector spacing.

field.name: BIV
field.description: Base Address of Interrupt Vector Table BIV. The address in the BIV register must be aligned to an even byte address halfword address . Because of the simple ORing of the left shifted priority number and the contents of the BIV register the alignment of the base address of the vector table must be to a power of two boundary dependent on the number of interrupt entries used. For the full range of 256 interrupt entries an alignment to an 8 KByte boundary is required. If fewer sources are used the alignment requirements are correspondingly relaxed.

register.name: BTV
register.description: CPUx Base Trap Vector Table Pointer resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0A0000100}

field.name: BTV
field.description: Base Address of Trap Vector Table BTV. The address in the BTV register must be aligned to an even byte address halfword address . Also due to the simple ORing of the left shifted trap identification number and the contents of the BTV register the alignment of the base address of the vector table must be to a power of two boundary. There are eight different trap classes resulting in Trap Classes from 0 to 7. The contents of BTV should therefore be set to at least a 256 byte boundary 8 Trap Classes 8 word spacing .

register.name: ISP

field.name: ISP
field.description: Interrupt Stack Pointer ISP

register.name: ICR
register.description: CPUx Interrupt Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: CCPN
field.description: Current CPU Priority Number CCPN. The Current CPU Priority Number CCPN bit field indicates the current priority level of the CPU. It is automatically updated by hardware on entry or exit of Interrupt Service Routines ISRs and through the execution of a BISR instruction. CCPN can also be updated through an MTCR instruction.

field.name: IE
field.description: Global Interrupt Enable Bit IE. The interrupt enable bit globally enables the CPU service request system. Whether a service request is delivered to the CPU depends on the individual Service Request Enable Bits SRE in the SRNs and the current state of the CPU. ICR.IE is automatically updated by hardware on entry and exit of an Interrupt Service Routine ISR . ICR.IE is cleared to 0 when an interrupt is taken and is restored to the previous value when the ISR executes an RFE instruction to terminate itself. ICR.IE can also be updated through the execution of the ENABLE DISABLE MTCR and BISR instructions.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Interrupt system is globally disabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Interrupt system is globally enabled

field.name: PIPN
field.description: Pending Interrupt Priority Number PIPN. A read only bit field that is updated by the ICU at the end of each interrupt arbitration process. It indicates the priority number of the pending service request. ICR.PIPN is set to 0 when no request is pending and at the beginning of each new arbitration process. ...

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 No valid pending request.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Request pending lowest priority.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_255255
enumeratedValue.description: FF Request pending highest priority.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 The CDC is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 The CDC is enabled.

field.name: HALT
field.description: CPU Halt Request Status Field HALT. HALT can be set or cleared by software. HALT 0 is the actual Halt bit. HALT 1 is a mask bit to specify whether or not HALT 0 is to be updated on a software write. HALT 1 is always read as 0. HALT 1 must be set to 1 in order to update HALT 0 by software R read W write .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 R CPU running. W HALT 0 unchanged.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 R CPU halted. W HALT 0 unchanged.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 R Not Applicable. W reset HALT 0 .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 R Not Applicable. W If DBGSR.DE 1 The CDC is enabled set HALT 0 . If DBGSR.DE 0 The CDC is not enabled HALT 0 is left unchanged.

field.name: SIH
field.description: Suspend in Halt SIH. State of the Suspend In signal.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 The Suspend In signal is negated. The CPU is not in Halt Mode except when the Halt mechanism is set following a Debug Event or a write to DBGSR.HALT .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 The Suspend In signal is asserted. The CPU is in Halt Mode.

enumeratedValue.description: 01 Start the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Stop the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 Toggle the performance counter control i.e. start it if it is currently stopped stop it if it is currently running .

register.name: SWEVT

field.name: EVTA

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 000 BOD 0 Disabled. BOD 1 Disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 001 BOD 0 Pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 010 BOD 0 Halt and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Halt.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 011 BOD 0 Breakpoint trap and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Breakpoint trap.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_44
enumeratedValue.description: 100 BOD 0 Breakpoint interrupt 0 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Breakpoint interrupt 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_55
enumeratedValue.description: 101 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 1 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 1. If not implemented None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_66
enumeratedValue.description: 110 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 2 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 2. If not implemented None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_77
enumeratedValue.description: 111 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3. If not implemented None.

field.name: BBM

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Break before make BBM .

field.name: BOD
field.description: Breakout Disable BOD

enumeratedValue.description: 0 BRKOUT signal asserted according to the action specified in the EVTA field.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 BRKOUT signal not asserted. This takes priority over any assertion generated by the EVTA field.

field.name: SUSP
field.description: CDC Suspend Out Signal State SUSP. Value to be assigned to the CDC suspend out signal when the event is raised.

field.name: CNT
field.description: Counter CNT. When this event occurs adjust the control of the performance counters in task mode as follows

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 No change.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Start the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Stop the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 Toggle the performance counter control i.e. start it if it is currently stopped stop it if it is currently running .

field.description: Debug Context Save Area Pointer DCXValue. Address where the debug context is stored following a breakpoint trap.

register.name: DBGTCR
register.description: CPUx Debug Trap Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x1}

field.name: DTA
field.description: Debug Trap Active Bit DTA. A breakpoint trap may only be taken in the condition DTA 0. Taking a breakpoint trap sets the DTA bit to one. Further breakpoint traps are therefore disabled until such time as the breakpoint trap handler clears the DTA bit or until the breakpoint trap handler terminates with a RFM.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No breakpoint trap is active.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 A breakpoint Trap is active

register.name: SEGEN
register.description: CPUx SRI Error Generation Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ADFLIP
field.description: Address ECC Bit Flip ADFLIP. SRI address ECC Bits to be flipped on the next read or write transaction from the DMI when enabled by AE.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No Flip

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Flip

field.name: ADTYPE
field.description: Type of error ADTYPE

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 Data Master Address Phase

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Data Master Write Data

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Data Slave Read Data

field.name: AE
field.description: Activate Error Enable AE. Enabled the selective inverting of SRI ECC packet bits defined by ADFLIP. This bit will be cleared by hardware after the next SRI read or write transaction from the DMI.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Not Enabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Enabled

register.name: DSTR
register.description: CPUx Data Synchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRE
field.description: Scratch Range Error SRE. A scratch Range Error occurs whenever an access to the data scratch is outside the range of the SRAM.

field.name: GAE
field.description: Global Address Error GAE. Load or store to local code scratch address outside of the lower 1MByte.

field.name: LBE
field.description: Load Bus Error LBE. A Load Bus Error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a load from external memory.

field.name: DRE
field.description: Local DLMU Range Error DRE. A DLMU Range Error occurs whenever an access to the local DLMU region is outside the physically implemented memory.

field.name: CRE
field.description: Cache Refill Error CRE. A Cache Refill Error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a cache refill from external memory.

field.name: DTME
field.description: DTAG MSIST Error DTME. Access to memory mapped DTAG range outside of physically implemented memory.

field.name: LOE
field.description: Load Overlay Error LOE. Load to invalid overlay address.

field.name: SDE
field.description: Segment Difference Error SDE. Load or store access where base address is in different segment to access address.

field.name: SCE
field.description: Segment Crossing Error SCE. Load or store access across segment boundary.

field.name: CAC
field.description: CSFR Access Error CAC. Load or store to local CSFR space.

field.name: MPE
field.description: Memory Protection Error MPE. Data access violating memory protection.

field.name: CLE
field.description: Context Location Error CLE. Context operation to invalid location.

field.name: ALN
field.description: Alignment Error ALN. Data access causing alignment error.

register.name: DATR
register.description: CPUx Data Asynchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 DCache DRB enabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 DCache DRB Bypass disabled

register.name: PSTR
register.description: CPUx Program Synchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: FRE
field.description: Fetch Range Error FRE. A Fetch Range Error occurs whenever an access to the Program Scratch is outside the range of the SRAM.

field.name: FBE
field.description: Fetch Bus Error FBE. A Fetch bus error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a fetch from external memory. This will be set for both direct fetches from the bus and for cache refills.

field.name: FPE
field.description: Fetch Peripheral Error FPE. A Fetch peripheral error will be flagged whenever a fetch is attempted to peripheral space.

field.name: FME
field.description: Fetch MSIST Error FME. During SIST mode a fetch from the PTAG will cause a PSE trap to occur.

field.description: Timer0 Expired Flag TEXP0. Set when the corresponding timer expires. Cleared on any write to the TIMER0 register.

field.name: TEXP1

field.name: TEXP2
field.description: Timer1 Expired Flag TEXP2. Set when the corresponding timer expires. Cleared on any write to the TIMER1 register.

field.name: TTRAP
field.description: Temporal Protection Trap TTRAP. If set indicates that a TAE trap has been requested. Any subsequent TAE traps are disabled. A write clears the flag and re enables TAE traps.

register.name: TIMER[%s]
register.description: CPUx Temporal Protection System Timer Register 0 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: Timer
field.description: Temporal Protection Timer Timer. Writing zero de activates the Timer. Writing a non zero value starts the Timer. Any write clears the corresponding TPS CON.TEXP flag. Read returns the current Timer value.

register.description: CPUx Exception Entry Timer Load Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

register.description: CPUx Exception Entry Timer Current Value resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ENTRY_CVAL

field.name: EXIT_CVAL
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Current Value EXIT CVAL. Current value of the exception exit timer.

field.description: Exception Timer Class Enables EXTIM CLASS EN. Trap Class enables for exception timer.

field.description: Exception Exit Timer Class EXIT CLASS. Exception exit Timer Class of triggering trap.

field.name: EXIT_AT
field.description: Exception Exit Timer Alarm Triggered EXIT AT. Exception Exit Timer Alarm triggered sticky bit. Alarm triggered since last cleared.

field.name: ENTRY_TIN
field.description: Exception Entry Timer TIN ENTRY TIN. Exception Entry Timer TIN of triggering trap.

field.name: ENTRY_CLASS
field.description: Exception Entry Timer Class ENTRY CLASS. Exception Entry Timer Class of triggering trap.

field.name: ENTRY_AT

register.name: CON
register.description: CPUx Trap Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: TST
field.description: Trap Status TST

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No instruction captured. The next enabled exception will cause the exceptional instruction to be captured.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Instruction captured. No further enabled exceptions will be captured until TST is cleared.

field.name: TCL
field.description: Trap Clear TCL. Read always reads as 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No effect.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Clears the trapped instruction TST will be negated .

field.name: RM
field.description: Captured Rounding Mode RM. The rounding mode of the captured instruction. Only valid when TST is asserted. Note that this is the rounding mode supplied to the FPU for the exceptional instruction. UPDFL instructions may cause a trap and change the rounding mode. In this case the RM bits capture the input rounding mode

field.name: FXE
field.description: FX Trap Enable FXE. When set an instruction generating an FX exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FUE
field.description: FU Trap Enable FUE. When set an instruction generating an FU exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FZE
field.description: FZ Trap Enable FZE. When set an instruction generating an FZ exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FVE
field.description: FV Trap Enable FVE. When set an instruction generating an FV exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FIE
field.description: FI Trap Enable FIE. When set an instruction generating an FI exception will trigger a trap.

field.name: FX
field.description: Captured FX FX. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FX. Only valid when TST is asserted.

field.name: FU
field.description: Captured FU FU. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FU. Only valid when TST is asserted.

field.name: FZ
field.description: Captured FZ FZ. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FZ. Only valid when TST is asserted

field.name: FV
field.description: Captured FV FV. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FV. Only valid when TST is asserted

field.name: FI
field.description: Captured FI FI. Asserted if the captured instruction asserted FI. Only valid when TST is asserted

register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Program Counter Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: PC
field.description: Captured Program Counter PC. The program counter virtual address of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: OPC
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Opcode Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: OPC
field.description: Captured Opcode OPC. The secondary opcode of the captured instruction. When FPU TRAP OPC.FMT 0 only bits 3 0 are defined. OPC is valid only when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

field.name: FMT
field.description: Captured Instruction Format FMT. The format of the captured instruction s opcode. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 RRR

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 RR

field.name: DREG
field.description: Captured Destination Register DREG. The destination register of the captured instruction. ... Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Data general purpose register 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_1515
enumeratedValue.description: F Data general purpose register 15.

register.name: SRC1
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC1
field.description: Captured SRC1 Operand SRC1. The SRC1 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: SRC2
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC2
field.description: Captured SRC2 Operand SRC2. The SRC2 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

register.name: SRC3
register.description: CPUx Trapping Instruction Operand Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRC3
field.description: Captured SRC3 Operand SRC3. The SRC3 operand of the captured instruction. Only valid when FPU TRAP CON.TST is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 001 BOD 0 Pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 None.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_44
enumeratedValue.description: 100 BOD 0 Breakpoint interrupt 0 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 Breakpoint interrupt 0.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_77

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11

register.name: PCXI
register.description: CPUx Previous Context Information Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.description: Previous Context Pointer Offset Field PCXO. The PCXO and PCXS fields form the pointer PCX which points to the CSA of the previous context.

field.description: Upper or Lower Context Tag UL. Identifies the type of context saved. If the type does not match the type expected when a context restore operation is performed a trap is generated.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11

field.name: PIE

field.name: PCPN

register.name: PSW
register.description: CPUx Program Status Word resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0B80}

field.name: CDC
field.description: Call Depth Counter CDC. Consists of two variable width subfields. The first subfield consists of a string of zero or more initial 1 bits terminated by the first 0 bit. The remaining bits form the second subfield CDC.COUNT which constitutes the Call Depth Count value. The count value is incremented on each Call and is decremented on a Return. 0cccccc B 6 bit counter trap on overflow. 10ccccc B 5 bit counter trap on overflow. 110cccc B 4 bit counter trap on overflow. 1110ccc B 3 bit counter trap on overflow. 11110cc B 2 bit counter trap on overflow. 111110c B 1 bit counter trap on overflow. 1111110 B Trap every call Call Trace mode . 1111111 B Disable Call Depth Counting. When the call depth count CDC.COUNT overflows a trap CDO is generated. Setting the CDC to 1111110 B allows no bits for the counter and causes every call to be trapped. This is used for Call Depth Tracing. Setting the CDC to 1111111 B disables Call Depth Counting.

field.name: CDE
field.description: Call Depth Count Enable CDE. Enables call depth counting provided that the PSW.CDC mask field is not all set to 1. If PSW.CDC 1111111 B call depth counting is disabled regardless of the setting on the PSW.CDE bit.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Call depth counting is temporarily disabled. It is automatically re enabled after execution of the next Call instruction.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Call depth counting is enabled.

field.name: IS
field.description: Interrupt Stack Control IS. Determines if the current execution thread is using the shared global interrupt stack or a user stack.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 User Stack. If an interrupt is taken when the IS bit is 0 then the stack pointer register is loaded from the ISP register before execution starts at the first instruction of the Interrupt Service Routine ISR .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Shared Global Stack. If an interrupt is taken when the PSW.IS bit is 1 then the current value of the stack pointer is used by the Interrupt Service Routine ISR .

field.name: IO
field.description: Access Privilege Level Control I O Privilege IO. Determines the access level to special function registers and peripheral devices.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 User 0 Mode No peripheral access. Access to memory regions with the peripheral space attribute are prohibited and results in a PSE or MPP trap. This access level is given to tasks that need not directly access peripheral devices. Tasks at this level do not have permission to enable or disable interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 User 1 Mode Regular peripheral access. Enables access to common peripheral devices that are not specially protected including read write access to serial I O ports read access to timers and access to most I O status registers. Tasks at this level may disable interrupts.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Supervisor Mode Enables access to all peripheral devices. It enables read write access to core registers and protected peripheral devices. Tasks at this level may disable interrupts.

field.name: S
field.description: Safe Task Identifier S

field.name: USB
field.description: User Status Bits USB. The eight most significant bits of the PSW are designated as User Status Bits. These bits may be set or cleared as side effects of instruction execution. Refer to the TriCore Architecture manual for details.

register.name: BIV
register.description: CPUx Base Interrupt Vector Table Pointer resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: VSS
field.description: Vector Spacing Select VSS. 0 32 byte vector spacing. 1 8 Byte vector spacing.

field.name: BIV
field.description: Base Address of Interrupt Vector Table BIV. The address in the BIV register must be aligned to an even byte address halfword address . Because of the simple ORing of the left shifted priority number and the contents of the BIV register the alignment of the base address of the vector table must be to a power of two boundary dependent on the number of interrupt entries used. For the full range of 256 interrupt entries an alignment to an 8 KByte boundary is required. If fewer sources are used the alignment requirements are correspondingly relaxed.

register.name: BTV
register.description: CPUx Base Trap Vector Table Pointer resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0A0000100}

field.name: BTV
field.description: Base Address of Trap Vector Table BTV. The address in the BTV register must be aligned to an even byte address halfword address . Also due to the simple ORing of the left shifted trap identification number and the contents of the BTV register the alignment of the base address of the vector table must be to a power of two boundary. There are eight different trap classes resulting in Trap Classes from 0 to 7. The contents of BTV should therefore be set to at least a 256 byte boundary 8 Trap Classes 8 word spacing .

field.name: ISP
field.description: Interrupt Stack Pointer ISP

register.name: ICR
register.description: CPUx Interrupt Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: CCPN
field.description: Current CPU Priority Number CCPN. The Current CPU Priority Number CCPN bit field indicates the current priority level of the CPU. It is automatically updated by hardware on entry or exit of Interrupt Service Routines ISRs and through the execution of a BISR instruction. CCPN can also be updated through an MTCR instruction.

field.name: IE
field.description: Global Interrupt Enable Bit IE. The interrupt enable bit globally enables the CPU service request system. Whether a service request is delivered to the CPU depends on the individual Service Request Enable Bits SRE in the SRNs and the current state of the CPU. ICR.IE is automatically updated by hardware on entry and exit of an Interrupt Service Routine ISR . ICR.IE is cleared to 0 when an interrupt is taken and is restored to the previous value when the ISR executes an RFE instruction to terminate itself. ICR.IE can also be updated through the execution of the ENABLE DISABLE MTCR and BISR instructions.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Interrupt system is globally disabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Interrupt system is globally enabled

field.name: PIPN
field.description: Pending Interrupt Priority Number PIPN. A read only bit field that is updated by the ICU at the end of each interrupt arbitration process. It indicates the priority number of the pending service request. ICR.PIPN is set to 0 when no request is pending and at the beginning of each new arbitration process. ...

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 No valid pending request.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Request pending lowest priority.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_255255
enumeratedValue.description: FF Request pending highest priority.

field.description: Debug Enable DE. Determines whether the CDC is enabled or not.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 The CDC is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 The CDC is enabled.

field.name: HALT
field.description: CPU Halt Request Status Field HALT. HALT can be set or cleared by software. HALT 0 is the actual Halt bit. HALT 1 is a mask bit to specify whether or not HALT 0 is to be updated on a software write. HALT 1 is always read as 0. HALT 1 must be set to 1 in order to update HALT 0 by software R read W write .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 R CPU running. W HALT 0 unchanged.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 R CPU halted. W HALT 0 unchanged.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 R Not Applicable. W reset HALT 0 .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 R Not Applicable. W If DBGSR.DE 1 The CDC is enabled set HALT 0 . If DBGSR.DE 0 The CDC is not enabled HALT 0 is left unchanged.

field.name: SIH
field.description: Suspend in Halt SIH. State of the Suspend In signal.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 The Suspend In signal is negated. The CPU is not in Halt Mode except when the Halt mechanism is set following a Debug Event or a write to DBGSR.HALT .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 The Suspend In signal is asserted. The CPU is in Halt Mode.

field.name: SUSP
field.description: CDC Suspend Out Signal State SUSP. Value to be assigned to the CDC suspend out signal when the Debug Event is raised.

field.name: CNT
field.description: Counter CNT. When this event occurs adjust the control of the performance counters in task mode as follows

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 No change.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Start the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Stop the performance counters.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_33
enumeratedValue.description: 11 Toggle the performance counter control i.e. start it if it is currently stopped stop it if it is currently running .

enumeratedValue.name: Const_66

enumeratedValue.name: Const_77
enumeratedValue.description: 111 BOD 0 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3 and pulse BRKOUT Signal. BOD 1 If implemented breakpoint interrupt 3. If not implemented None.

register.name: TRIG_ACC
register.description: CPUx TriggerAddressx resetvalue={Debug Reset:0x0}

field.name: T0
field.description: Trigger 0 T0. active since last cleared

field.name: T1
field.description: Trigger 1 T1. active since last cleared

field.name: T2
field.description: Trigger 2 T2. active since last cleared

field.name: T3
field.description: Trigger 3 T3. active since last cleared

field.name: T4
field.description: Trigger 4 T4. active since last cleared

field.name: T5
field.description: Trigger 5 T5. active since last cleared

field.name: T6
field.description: Trigger 6 T6. active since last cleared

field.name: T7
field.description: Trigger 7 T7. active since last cleared

register.name: DMS
register.description: CPUx Debug Monitor Start Address resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: DMSValue
field.description: Debug Monitor Start Address DMSValue. The address at which monitor code execution begins when a breakpoint trap is taken.

register.name: DCX
register.description: CPUx Debug Context Save Area Pointer resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: DCXValue
field.description: Debug Context Save Area Pointer DCXValue. Address where the debug context is stored following a breakpoint trap.

register.name: DBGTCR
register.description: CPUx Debug Trap Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x1}

field.name: DTA
field.description: Debug Trap Active Bit DTA. A breakpoint trap may only be taken in the condition DTA 0. Taking a breakpoint trap sets the DTA bit to one. Further breakpoint traps are therefore disabled until such time as the breakpoint trap handler clears the DTA bit or until the breakpoint trap handler terminates with a RFM.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No breakpoint trap is active.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 A breakpoint Trap is active

register.name: SEGEN
register.description: CPUx SRI Error Generation Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ADFLIP
field.description: Address ECC Bit Flip ADFLIP. SRI address ECC Bits to be flipped on the next read or write transaction from the DMI when enabled by AE.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 No Flip

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Flip

field.name: ADTYPE
field.description: Type of error ADTYPE

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 00 Data Master Address Phase

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 01 Data Master Write Data

enumeratedValue.name: Const_22
enumeratedValue.description: 10 Data Slave Read Data

field.name: AE
field.description: Activate Error Enable AE. Enabled the selective inverting of SRI ECC packet bits defined by ADFLIP. This bit will be cleared by hardware after the next SRI read or write transaction from the DMI.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Not Enabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Enabled

register.name: DCON2
register.description: CPUx Data Control Register 2 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: DCACHE_SZE
field.description: Data Cache Size DCACHE SZE. In KBytes

field.name: DSCRATCH_SZE
field.description: Data Scratch Size DSCRATCH SZE. In KBytes

register.name: DSTR
register.description: CPUx Data Synchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SRE
field.description: Scratch Range Error SRE. A scratch Range Error occurs whenever an access to the data scratch is outside the range of the SRAM.

field.name: GAE
field.description: Global Address Error GAE. Load or store to local code scratch address outside of the lower 1MByte.

field.name: LBE
field.description: Load Bus Error LBE. A Load Bus Error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a load from external memory.

field.name: DRE
field.description: Local DLMU Range Error DRE. A DLMU Range Error occurs whenever an access to the local DLMU region is outside the physically implemented memory.

field.name: CRE
field.description: Cache Refill Error CRE. A Cache Refill Error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a cache refill from external memory.

field.name: DTME
field.description: DTAG MSIST Error DTME. Access to memory mapped DTAG range outside of physically implemented memory.

field.name: LOE
field.description: Load Overlay Error LOE. Load to invalid overlay address.

field.name: SDE
field.description: Segment Difference Error SDE. Load or store access where base address is in different segment to access address.

field.name: SCE
field.description: Segment Crossing Error SCE. Load or store access across segment boundary.

field.name: CAC
field.description: CSFR Access Error CAC. Load or store to local CSFR space.

field.name: MPE
field.description: Memory Protection Error MPE. Data access violating memory protection.

field.name: CLE
field.description: Context Location Error CLE. Context operation to invalid location.

field.name: ALN
field.description: Alignment Error ALN. Data access causing alignment error.

register.name: DATR
register.description: CPUx Data Asynchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: SBE
field.description: Store Bus Error SBE

field.name: CWE
field.description: Cache Writeback Error CWE

field.name: CFE
field.description: Cache Flush Error CFE

field.name: SOE
field.description: Store Overlay Error SOE

register.name: DEADD
register.description: CPUx Data Error Address Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: ERROR_ADDRESS
field.description: Error Address ERROR ADDRESS

register.name: DCON0
register.description: CPUx Data Memory Control Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x2}

field.name: DCBYP
field.description: Data Cache Bypass DCBYP

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 DCache DRB enabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 DCache DRB Bypass disabled

register.name: PSTR
register.description: CPUx Program Synchronous Trap Register resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: FRE
field.description: Fetch Range Error FRE. A Fetch Range Error occurs whenever an access to the Program Scratch is outside the range of the SRAM.

field.name: FBE
field.description: Fetch Bus Error FBE. A Fetch bus error will be set whenever the SRI flags an error due a fetch from external memory. This will be set for both direct fetches from the bus and for cache refills.

field.name: FPE
field.description: Fetch Peripheral Error FPE. A Fetch peripheral error will be flagged whenever a fetch is attempted to peripheral space.

field.name: FME
field.description: Fetch MSIST Error FME. During SIST mode a fetch from the PTAG will cause a PSE trap to occur.

register.name: PCON1
register.description: CPUx Program Control 1 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: PCINV
field.description: Program Cache Invalidate PCINV

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Write No effect normal instruction cache operation. Read Normal operation instruction cache available

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Write Initiate invalidation of entire instruction cache. Read Instruction cache invalidation in progress. Instruction cache unavailable.

field.name: PBINV
field.description: Program Buffer Invalidate PBINV. Write Operation This field returns 0 when read.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Write No effect. Normal program line buffer operation.

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Write Invalidate the program line buffer.

register.name: PCON2
register.description: CPUx Program Control 2 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x0}

field.name: PCACHE_SZE
field.description: Program Cache Size ICACHE in KBytes PCACHE SZE. In KBytes

field.name: PSCRATCH_SZE
field.description: Program Scratch Size in KBytes PSCRATCH SZE. In KBytes

register.name: PCON0
register.description: CPUx Program Control 0 resetvalue={Application Reset:0x2}

field.name: PCBYP
field.description: Program Cache Bypass PCBYP

enumeratedValue.name: Const_00
enumeratedValue.description: 0 Cache enabled

enumeratedValue.name: Const_11
enumeratedValue.description: 1 Cache bypass disabled
